newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch gold reserves down Dfl 1.383 bln by Feb 24.
newsitem.headline: Dutch gold reserves down Dfl 1.383 bln by Feb 24.

text.p: Dutch official gold reserves fell by 1.383 billion guilders to a book value of 13.581 billion in the week to February 24, central bank data showed.
The Dutch central bank said on January 13 it had sold 300 tonnes of bullion in 1996 and that the transactions as forward sales would not show up in official statistics until February.
As the finance ministry holds gold at a book value of 13,900 guilders per kilo, the figures indicate that last week 99,496 kilos of gold were settled as part of that sale.
